snippet: The attackers overran large parts of Albu Faraj, less than two days after officials declared that they had begun an offensive against the extremists, the police said.
abstract: Islamic State militants attack Iraqi government-held town of Albu Faraj, killing 25 police officers and soldiers as well as 15 family members of local police officers; convoy of reinforcements is attacked by suicide bomber on way to town.

byline.contributor: Iraqi employees of The New York Times contributed reporting from Baghdad and Ramadi.

lead_paragraph: The attackers overran large parts of Albu Faraj, less than two days after officials declared that they had begun an offensive against the extremists, the police said.

headline.main: ISIS Strikes Iraqi Town, Exacting Deadly Toll
headline.print_headline: ISIS Strikes Iraqi Town, Exacting Deadly Toll

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
